intro: Cacalia corymbiformis, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments and has heart-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. Its flowers are usually blue or purple and bloom in the summer months. Cacalia corymbiformis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
